title: The fact that people want 10 bans shows that Riot can't balance this game right
body:
If the community wants 10 bans because there are too many champions that have too easy of a time against almost every champion and Riot are ok with doing that, then there is a balancing problem. 

I understand that some champions are always going to be annoying because of their kits (Yasuo, Teemo) but if there is a champion base that outweighs others significantly (Lee Sin, Vayne, LeBlanc, etc) and there way to fixing it is by adding more bans, then there is a huge counter play issue here that should be looked at after 10 bans are put in play. 

It almost feels like it is a game of luck what everyone is playing, everyone is praying that..

1) People ban the appropriate "OP" champions
2) The remaining "OP" champions aren't picked (because there is way more than 6 to ban)
3) If people do pick these op champions, hope they play like ass, or it's gg.

Am I the only one who feels this way?

Either way, my point was that the number of champions is irrelevant to balance. Not that DotA's balance tactic is better for League. League had a decent one, but they decided to stop using it in favor of 'niches', which is causing the game to fail from a balance standpoint.

Yi is too binary to be strong in higher levels of play. He only brings damage and relies on getting fed and stomping games. If they balance Yi to be viable in Challenger games he's going to absolutely destroy Bronze. And like it or not, but the vast majority of all players are Bronze and low Silver. 
So either you make Yi so strong that ~81.84% (Bronze and Silver) of the community can't deal with him or you leave him useless for 0.97% (Diamond+) of the community. The community already gets super upset any time Riot does anything for the 1%, how do you think they'd react if they balanced everything around them?

If something is too binary to be allowed to be effective past silver, it shows that there are design flaws that should be fixed via a rework of some degree.


However, Riot refuses to fix him for the same reason they refuse to fix champs like Tryndamere. So, again, it comes down to Riot poorly managing the game's balance.

Yi and Tryndamere were designed like 8 years ago, they're relics of the past and they'd have to be drastically changed to be viable. But then everyone will complain that "it's not the same champion, they're ruined", and to some extent they would be right. You'd have to make 2 new champions and slap the old names on them, like how they did with Sion.
They don't have unlimited resources or developers, so they have to prioritize who gets reworked. Warwick is most likely reworked before January is over, and then I forgot who was next but I believe it was Urgot. After that they have the Divers, which might include Tryndamere and Yi actually.

There's a lot more than that. 

Warwick, Galio, Urgot, Teemo, Divers, Eve, Akali, Irelia, Kayle/Morg, Ryze's seasonal rework, Pantheon, and I believe Nunu were already all cited. I don't remember Tryn or Yi being officially slated, but I think they wanted to get to Tryn eventually. No word on Yi, IIRC.

It'll be a really long time before they hit Yi or Tryn with a rework, most likely.
